qas.question: What did the shramana movements challenge?
Who was the founder of Jainism?
What path did Buddha find to soothe the strictness of Sramana religions?
What belief system taught the idea of samsara?

context: Increasing urbanisation of India in 7th and 6th centuries BCE led to the rise of new ascetic or shramana movements which challenged the <a0_0>orthodoxy of rituals<a0_0/>. <a1_0>Mahavira<a1_0/> (c. 549–477 BC), proponent of Jainism, and <a2_0>Buddha<a2_0/> (c. 563-483), founder of Buddhism were the most prominent icons of this movement. <a4_0>Shramana<a4_0/> gave rise to the concept of the cycle of birth and death, the concept of samsara, and the concept of liberation. Buddha found a <a3_0>Middle Way<a3_0/> that ameliorated the extreme asceticism found in the Sramana religions.
